info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 1:48PM CDT until June 05 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Canadian River at Amarillo 19N affecting Potter County. For the Canadian River...including Amarillo 19N...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Canadian River at Amarillo 19N. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Dirt road that runs east alongside the river channel becomes flooded. This road leads to Rosita Creek Flats Recreation Area, where primitive camping occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 4.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 6.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall to 2.7 feet early Wednesday afternoon then rise again. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
